titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Augustus Ehinger diary transcript, 1846-1847 MS 282
titlestmt.author: Sarah Biggerstaff

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 20:45:48 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: A diary written by Augustus Ehinger during his year in the U.S. Army during the Mexican-American War.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Augusts Ehinger was born in Speyer, Rhein Phlaz, Bavaria, on September 14, 1821 and came to the United States with his parents at the age of twelve. He lived in Ohio, Illinois, and Iowa where he died on January 9, 1881.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The diary of Augustus Ehinger begins June 15, 1846 and ends June 28, 1847. The diary chronicles Ehinger's travels and experiences as a private in the Second Illinois Regiment during the Mexican-American War. Ehinger writes about simple daily activities as well as battles, marches, and other soldiers in his regiment. The location of the original diary is unknown.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This diary was donated on October 10, 1979 by Colonel Charles F. Ward via the Jefferson Davis Association, Rice University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Augustus Ehinger diary transcript, 1846-1847, MS 282, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Augustus Ehinger diary must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Corporations)
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Illinois Infantry Regiment, 2nd (1846-1847)

did.unittitle: 116 page typed transcript of Augustus Ehinger's diary
